Satan often cast his shadow across their pathway to obscure their view of divine light and darken their faith and confidence in God. But they would not yield, and the Lord gave them wisdom and power to prevail with Him in prayer. As they followed the course of study outlined for them in the courts of Babylon, they made it their aim to become statesmen who would never sacrifice principle. They knew that they were in an enemy's country, under the power of the Babylonian king, and they were obedient in all things save 


                                    -129- 

where they were asked to sacrifice principle."--Letter 34, 1900, pp. 3-5. (To "My Brethren and Sisters in Australia," February 24, 1900.)
